description: Servo is a small motor with arm that can be pointing at a specific direction.

contents.name: angle
contents.description: Specifies the angle of the arm.

contents.name: enabled
contents.description: Turn the power to the servo on/off.

contents.name: offset
contents.description: Correction applied to the angle to account for the servo arm drift.

contents.name: min_angle
contents.description: Lowest angle that can be set.

contents.name: max_angle
contents.description: Highest angle that can be set.

contents.name: variant
contents.description:
Specifies the type of servo motor.
* Positional Rotation Servos: Positional servos can rotate the shaft in about half of the circle,
with features to avoid over-rotating. Most servo have a range of 180째 but some allow 270째 or 360째.
* Linear Servos: linear servos are also like a positional servo, but with additional gears to the adjust the output from circular to back-and-forth.

contents.name: stall_torque
contents.description: The servo motor will stop rotating when it is trying to move a ``stall_torque`` weight at a radial distance of ``1.0`` cm.
